resources.name: Tricks on Simple Interest
resources.author: BYJU'S Exam Prep
resources.description: This resource discusses the basic questions that are usually asked about Simple Interest and how you can solve them using the normal as well as Shortcut approach.

resources.name: Simple Interest Formula
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This resource is a video that walks you through some example problems using the Simple Interest formula. He talks about the thought process while solving these questions.

resources.name: MA 110 Syllabus
resources.author: Dr. Joy Becker, Fall 2022
resources.description: This is the syllabus for MA 110 (Fall 2022).

resources.name: MA 111 Syllabus
resources.author: Dr. Joy Becker, Winter 2023
resources.description: This is the syllabus for MA 111 (Winter 2023).

resources.name: Math with Mr. J
resources.author: Math with Mr. J
resources.description: This YouTube channel works through many different topics covered in this class, from graphing to geometry to basic algebra. If you are struggling with a topic, this channel most likely has a video covering it or something similar to it.

resources.name: Introduction to Number Theory
resources.author: Bullis Student Tutors
resources.description: This video serves as a great overview to number theory, which is one of the main topics covered in MA 110. It also provides a few real-world examples where number theory can be applied!!

resources.name: Algebra Basics: Graphing On The Coordinate Plane
resources.author: Math Antics
resources.description: This video is a great introduction to graphing different points on a cartesian plane. He uses a very easy strategy and makes it simple to understand!!

resources.name: Intro to rational & irrational numbers
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This video discusses the difference between rational and irrational numbers, and how you can easily distinguish between the two.

resources.name: Introduction to Geometry
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This covers almost every single topic you will need to know related to geometry, and gives examples of how those concepts apply to different problems. Terrific video if struggling with geometric concepts.

resources.name: Introduction to Probability, Basic Overview - Sample Space, & Tree Diagrams
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This is a great introduction video when first learning about probability. The video maps the concepts out very clearly and works slowly to help you get a grasp on this new idea.

resources.name: Laws of sines and cosines
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This resource helps students understand the law of sin and cos by explaining how to do them and going through different examples.

resources.name: Graphing Logarithmic Functions
resources.author: Varsity Tutors
resources.description: This resource describes how to graph log functions. It has interactive examples to help students understand each part of the function and how it translates onto the graph.

resources.name: Shifting, Stretching and Reflecting Parent Function Graphs
resources.author: Mario's Math Tutoring
resources.description: This video goes through and explains all of the different types of transformations: shifting, stretching, and reflection. It is a shorter video and it does a really good job explaining each transformation.

resources.name: Discrete Probability Distribution
resources.author: Cuemath
resources.description: This source gives a helpful insight to discrete distributions. Some of the different types, examples and definitions can be found here!

resources.name: Continuous Probability Distribution
resources.author: Statistics How To
resources.description: This resource gives a definition of continuous distributions, the different types, and a comparison between discrete and continuous distributions.

resources.name: The Central Limit Theorem, Clearly Explained!!!
resources.author: StatQuest with Josh Starmer
resources.description: This YouTube video gives a clear explanation of the central limit theorem!

resources.name: Linear Functions
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This resource covers all you need to know about concepts of linear equations, including how to calculate slope and the different forms of functions.

resources.name: Difference Quotient & Derivatives
resources.author: Mario's Math Tutoring
resources.description: In this video, you'll learn everything you need to know about derivatives, from first principles to advanced techniques for solving complex problems. It also touches on how to calculate derivatives using difference quotients.

resources.name: Slope field to visualize solutions | First order differential equations
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: In this video, you'll learn how to sketch slopes fields for first-order differential equations and interpret the information they provide about the behavior of solutions over time.

resources.name: Euler's method | Differential equations
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This tutorial provides a step-by-step guide to using Euler's Method to solve differential equations. It also provides examples and practice problems.

resources.name: Basic antiderivatives rules
resources.author: stonesizzle
resources.description: This video covers the basic antiderivative rules and includes techniques for evaluating and graphing integrals.

resources.name: Antiderivatives
resources.author: BriTheMathGuy
resources.description: The video provides an introduction to antiderivatives and demonstrates how to use them to solve basic integration problems.

resources.name: Trapezoidal Rule
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: In this resource, you can find explanations on how to use the trapezoidal rule to estimate the area under a curve. It also works through a step-by-step example and practice problems.

resources.name: Simpson's Rule & Numerical Integration
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: In this resource, you can find explanations on how to use the Simpson rule to approximate definite integrals. It also works through a step-by-step example and practice problems.

resources.name: Midpoint Rule & Riemann Sums
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: In this resource, you can find explanations on how to use the midpoint rule to approximate definite integrals. It also works through a step-by-step example of how and when to use the rule and practice problems.

resources.name: Improved Euler's Method pen and paper example
resources.author: Fergus Yuille
resources.description: In this resource, you can find explanations on how to use the improved Euler’s Method to approximate solutions to differential equations as well as definite integrals. It also works through a step-by-step example and practice problems.

resources.name: 4th-Order Runge-Kutta Method
resources.author: Prof. Mark Owkes - Montana State University
resources.description: In this resource, you can find explanations on how to use the Runge-Kutta method to approximate solutions to differential equations. It also works through a step-by-step example and practice problems.

resources.name: Sequences and Series (Arithmetic & Geometric) Quick Review
resources.author: Mario's Math Tutoring
resources.description: This resource gives an overview of the definition and properties of sequences and series. It touches on the differences between arithmetic and geometric series and how you can identify them easily.

resources.name: Convergence and Divergence - Introduction to Series
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This video provides a comprehensive overview of convergence and divergence in calculus, and talks about how you can easily identify and analyze them when they appear in series or sequences.

resources.name: Power Series & Intervals of Convergence
resources.author: Dr. Trefor Bazett
resources.description: This video provides a detailed explanation of the power series, including its convergence and divergence, and how to derive and use the series.

resources.name: Algebra Problem Solver
resources.author: Mathway
resources.description: This calculator was a lifesaver throughout MA 250. All you have to do is input your equations or take a picture (if you’re using your phone) and it instantly gives step-by-step solutions. (But you have to word your question right if you’re typing it in!). It can handle a wide range of mathematical problems, from basic algebra to advanced calculus.

resources.name: Exponential models & differential equations
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This video explains the general exponential function y=y0*e^kt, which is used when a population grows proportionally to its size.

resources.name: The logistic growth model
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This video describes the logistic differential equation, which is used when a population grows proportionally to its size until it reaches a certain size.

resources.name: Slope fields introduction
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: In this video, you'll learn how to draw slope fields and use them to find particular solutions to differential equations.

resources.name: Absolute minima & maxima (entire domain)
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This link is to a video on Khan Academy that demonstrates how to evaluate max and min in calculus. I put this on there because when I was first learning calculus, this was an area I struggled with. I hope the video helps!

resources.name: Derivative Calculator
resources.author: Symbolab
resources.description: Nothing was more reassuring than knowing if I solved a difficult derivative for a group homework assignment or online homework. This link takes you to a derivative calculator that should solve any equation you plug into it. It is a great way to check to see if you were right and to clean up any tiny mistakes you might make.

resources.name: Implicit Differentiation
resources.author: Professor Dave Explains
resources.description: The last helpful link I have for this class is over implicit differentiation. I wanted to put this on here because he explains the lesson well and it can really help you when getting into related rates, which is usually taught right after implicit differentiation. I hope this video makes sense.

resources.name: Calculus Video Playlist
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This resource has many trusted videos that go through explanations and example problems for many integral things as well as Taylor series! Videos 127-256 are most relevant to MA 252.

resources.name: Integral Calculus
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: Khan Academy has 5 units on integral calculus with videos and practice problems for each section covered within MA 252.

resources.name: Integral Calculator
resources.author: Wolfram|Alpha
resources.description: This resource can be used to check your answers for integrations, as well as showing a graph of the integral.

resources.name: Desmos Graphing Calculator
resources.author: Desmos
resources.description: If you go to the graphing calculator and click the three lines in the upper left corner of the page, you can pull up example graphs that have polar coordinates, integrals, and Taylor series. This can be a great resource to help someone see these concepts on a graph and you can interact with the settings of them to see how they change as you manipulate them.

resources.name: Paul's Online Notes
resources.author: Paul Dawkins
resources.description: This includes helpful notes about Calculus 1-3. Dr. Becker and the Dr. Birgens all recommend reviewing some Calc 1 & 2 materials as a way for studying for this course as well. It includes practice problems and written notes.

resources.name: Multivariable Calculus
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: Khan Academy: Enough said. Invaluable resource for all things math-related.

resources.name: Essence of calculus
resources.author: 3Blue1Brown
resources.description: This is a decent resource for Calculus. It is maybe a bit high-level, but I appreciate the animations and being able to see some of the different stuff. There is another playlist for Linear Algebra of someone doing that course that is probably better than the calculus one.

resources.name: Other Multivariable Calculus Websites & Resources
resources.author: Monroe Community College
resources.description: This is a list of other resources on Monroe's website. Control+F to search the topic you are looking for.

resources.name: Python Tutorial
resources.author: W3Schools
resources.description: This is a very extensive tutorial if you want to learn more about and practice Python programming concepts. It also works well if you need a refresher and just want a quick reference to look at. Definitely go through the tabs on the left to learn more about whichever topic you're interested in. The website also features interactive environments for you to practice each concept on the go!

resources.name: Intro to Programming Python flashcards
resources.author: Quizlet
resources.description: This is a collection of flashcards to help you study your basic Python programming concepts, featuring definitions of terms such as functions, variables, lists, strings, and while loops.

resources.name: Zelle Graphics Reference (graphics.py v5)
resources.author: Dr. John Zelle
resources.description: This is the go-to reference for whenever you need to figure out how to do something with the Zelle Graphics. Skim through it or use Control+F to find explanations and examples on how to do specific things such as drawing circles, setting window coordinates, or changing colors.

resources.name: Python Programming Textbook Resources
resources.author: Dr. John Zelle
resources.description: This resource contains links to PowerPoint slides on each chapter of the CS 120 textbook, as well as all the code from it, so that you never have to painfully copy-paste it and wrestle with Python indentation again!

resources.name: Loops and Iterations - For/While Loops
resources.author: Corey Schafer
resources.description: This video covers for and while loops in Python, including the difference between iterating over a list by index vs. over items. This video also contains lots of examples and use cases.
